## Natural history notes

Sandyfield Beaksedge (Rhynchospora megalocarpa) is a native sedge found in the southeastern United States. Like its name suggests, this plant loves sandy environments and can typically be found in sandhill and shrub habitats. The genus of this species, Rhynchospora, comes from two Greek words.The first one, rhynchos, means beak, and the second, spora, means seed, together describing the shape of the plant's seeds!
